伦敦东部的Bethnal Green Working男子俱乐部已推出了“战斗基金”众筹以拯救场地。

该空间一直是各种音乐，喜剧和戏剧演出的主持人，多年来一直举办过众多的开创性表演。包容性的建筑已上市，并拥有合法证书 - 承认该二手级是官方的歌舞表演剧院。但是，这些保护措施不足以使场地免于受到威胁。

由Bethnal Green Working Men's Club（FOBGWMC）的朋友（由当地人，表演者，下注者，程序员和工会成员组成的社区团体）创建，“战斗基金”将有助于付费，以说服塔尔塔小村庄委员会拯救俱乐部。

该基金需要在4月8日之前筹集12,000英镑，该基金将支付全面的特许调查和建筑物估值，以及计划申请成本，这将使至关重要
建筑物的保护。

该基金还拥有18,000英镑的扩展目标，这将使FOBGWMC能够制定有财务预测的强大商业计划，并支付所有咨询和会计师费用。

每个向该基金捐款的人都有机会赢得BGWMC商品的奖励，包括艺术家劳伦斯品牌的A3俱乐部印刷品，以捐款超过70英镑，BGWMC啤酒垫，以超过30英镑的捐款，以及Save BGWMC广告系列的捐款明信片，以超过20英镑的捐款。

Equity的品种组织者Nick Keegan在新闻稿中分享了：“以这种规模购买社区将不是很小的任务。我们试图对此绝对现实。我们认为，BGWMC和Tower Hamlets Council社区之间的合作伙伴关系确实有能力实现这一目标。

“我们认为，保存这种独特的文化设施至关重要，并为其提供一个机会，继续为当地的Tower Hamlets，LGBTQ+社区和伦敦的更广泛的文化挂毯提供服务。我们决心建立该案件，并确保BGWMC的文化和社会价值很明显。”

Keegan继续说：“ BGWMC是伦敦文化遗产的关键和不可替代的固定装置。它一直是该市新艺术家和文化工作者发展的催化剂，这是LGBTQ+社区的安全空间，并且是一栋拥有100多年历史的建筑，作为社区拥有的空间。我们至关重要的是，我们将BGWMC保留为子孙后代，并允许其遗产继续前进。透明

伯特纳尔绿色工作男子俱乐部是英国受到威胁的无数基层场所之一。 MVT已经警告说， 该国的演出空间在没有紧急政府行动的情况下“越过悬崖” 。

例如，到2023年底，有一个明显的警告指出， 英国将损失10％的基层音乐场所，而MVT结束了这一年，告诉NME 2023年《 2023年》是“场地关闭最糟糕的一年”，而“音乐产业中没有人似乎都在乎”。

这些问题也加入了2024年，并在1月份发表了一份新报告，显示“灾难”在2023年袭击了英国的基层音乐场所。其中的主要发现是，125个英国场地放弃了现场音乐，其中一半以上完全关闭了 - 包括巴斯的传奇痣。

特色艺术家联盟的首席执行官戴维·马丁（David Martin）在2月进一步强调了音乐家和场地所有者所面临的斗争，当时他谈到了基层场地的迅速下降，对英国人才造成了巨大损害。

最近， NME报道了政府如何开始干预， 文化，媒体和体育委员会欢迎政府对竞技场及以上演出征税的新支持，以保护基层。

此举是由Coldplay之类的人实施的，它看到了一部分是由大型旅行赚取的钱来帮助确保较小场所的未来的一部分， 进入Shikari ， Katy Perry和Sam Fender

在MVT争辩说，由于最近的预算宣布，巡回演出和艺术家已经遭受了“巡回演出的完全崩溃”，这一势头势头会威胁到英国音乐界的结构。

委员会主席Caroline Dinenage MP在给国务卿Lisa Nandy的信中写道：“我们当地社区中的大量场所被迫关闭商店，这使艺术家，推动者和其他从事基层音乐的斗争的现实陷入了困境。” “有警告更令人沮丧的未来。”

作为回应，音乐场所信托基金会首席执行官马克·戴维德（Mark Davyd）告诉NME ，虽然“在该委员会的工作中有大量庆祝”和政府对其的回应，但迪纳尼奇坚持对变革时间表的坚持必须进行。

他告诉NME ：“由于这一询问，当我们的基层音乐界对其文化，社会和经济价值以及影响力得到适当尊重时，我们现在可以看到一个明确的日期。” “现场音乐生态系统的重大积极变化，无论是通过基层贡献，商业利率审查还是政府的新投资和所有权方法引起的机会。”

Pink Floyd帖子宣布重新发布1972年《庞贝现场电影》的重新发布，首先出现在NME上。

;

Pompeii - McMlxxii的Pink Floyd的电影院发行已宣布。

1972年标志性电影的新版本将于4月24日在全球电影院和IMAX上发行。门票从3月5日开始销售，您可以单击此处以获取更多信息。

  • 阅读更多： 为什么新的乌克兰福利歌曲“ Hey Hey Rise Up”可能是Pink Floyd的完美最终表演

由于实验性的风格和诸如“月球黑暗的一面”和“墙壁”， Pink Floyd仍然是有史以来最具影响力的乐队之一。电影《平克·弗洛伊德（Pink Floyd）：庞贝（Pompeii）的直播》被认为是音乐史上的开创性作品，在全球明星之前就展示了乐队，并鉴于表演的独特情况。

环境是意大利庞贝的古罗马圆形剧场。乐队从职业生涯的那一刻起典型的演出，尽管除了基本电影摄制组外，没有观众出现。表演使用了乐队的常规旅游设备，包括移动8轨录音机。

它影响了许多音乐视频和表演，据说是电影的粉丝，野兽男孩，科恩（Korn ）和Radiohead 。平克·弗洛伊德（Pink Floyd）的大卫·吉尔默（David Gilmour）于2016年回到圆形剧场，在观众面前演出了两场音乐会。

新闻稿中写道：“庞贝的平克·弗洛伊德（Pink Floyd）预先发布“月亮的黑暗面”的发布。这部电影记录了平克·弗洛伊德（Pink Floyd）在大西洋两边成为专辑排行榜的巨人之前所做的事情 - 直到今天，他们的音乐仍在庆祝。

“这部独特而身临其境的电影坐落在意大利庞贝的古老罗马圆形剧场的令人难以忘怀的美丽遗迹中，捕捉了平克·弗洛伊德（Pink Floyd），表演了无观众的亲密音乐会”。

“在1971年10月拍摄的演出是在庞贝举行的第一场现场音乐会，并以“回声”为特色，'''''''''''''''''''此外，这部电影还包括乐队在Abbey Road Studios的“月亮黑暗面”上开始作品的罕见幕后录像。

这部电影是从当时使用的原始35毫米底片中恢复的，最近发现了。它也将伴随着一张现场表演的现场专辑。

“自1994年以来，我一直在庞贝（Pompeii）寻找难以捉摸的电影《平克·弗洛伊德（Pink Floyd ）》（Pink Floyd），因此最近发现1972年原始35mm剪裁的底片是一个非常特殊的时刻。” Pink Floyd修复总监Lana Topham说。 “新恢复的版本介绍了第一个完整的90分钟剪裁，将表演的60分钟源编辑与不久之后拍摄的其他修道院公路录音棚纪录片片段相结合”。

最近，宣布一部有关乐队已故创始人Syd Barrett的电影， 由一个完全未知的制片人制作。

保罗·麦卡特尼（Paul McCartney）帖子宣布了新书《翼：乐队的故事》，首先出现在NME上。

;

保罗·麦卡特尼（Paul McCartney）宣布了一本名为《翅膀：乐队的故事》的新书的详细信息。查看下面的详细信息。

  • 阅读更多： 一只手拍手评论：Paul McCartney和Wings电影在工作中展示了一位大师

这本新书定于11月4日到达，是标志性乐队的口述历史，由保罗，他的妻子琳达（Linda）和丹尼·莱恩（Denny Laine）于1971年成立，此前是甲壳虫乐队的巨大成功。

被描述为“对20世纪后期的歌曲，合作和表演的激动，立体庆典”，这本书是从麦卡特尼和乐队轨道上的麦卡特尼和其他主要参与者的无数访谈中汲取的。

在Instagram上查看此帖子

保罗·麦卡特尼（Paul McCartney）（@paulmccartney）分享的帖子

它探讨了乐队在专辑中的影响，并在他们的职业生涯中遵循了阵容的各种化身。轶事包括他们在尼日利亚被抢劫的时间，在英国大学厅的惊喜露面，以及他们如何撰写热门歌曲，包括“让'em in in in in”，“ live and live and live''，die''，``乐队''等等。

Wings：乐队的故事中有100多张照片，其中许多照片从未见过。这本书还将“为甲壳虫乐队的分手产生直接的后果和地震全球影响，随着音乐景观和口味开始散发出来，并与社会景色散开，并散发出来。”

在谈到新书时，麦卡特尼说：“我很高兴能回到翅膀的时代，并通过这本书重温我们的一些疯狂冒险。”

“在甲壳虫乐队有时会感到疯狂之后，从头开始。有一些非常困难的时刻，我经常质疑自己的决定。但是随着我们的情况更好，我想，“好吧，这真的很好”，”他补充说。 “我们证明翅膀可能是一个非常好的乐队。以甲壳虫乐队的方式与巨大的观众一起玩，并以不同的方式产生影响。这是一个巨大的嗡嗡声。”

翼：乐队的故事将在以后进行预订。

这本书的新闻在确认乐队的经典专辑“ Venus and Mars”几周后就到来了。定于3月21日发行，Wings的1975年第四台录音室唱片的新版本将以特殊的半速掌握版的形式到达。

这本书和专辑《重新发行》都是乐队更大的庆祝活动的一部分，他们在1981年解散之前对音乐界产生了巨大的全球影响。

乐队周围的其他新版本包括电影《一手拍手》的戏剧发行，以及伴随的1974年现场现场专辑。两者都在2024年到达。

那年早些时候，乐队还分享了他们1973年的第三张专辑《乐队In the Run》 。

在其他新闻中， 保罗·麦卡特尼（Paul McCartney）最近嘲笑他希望今年结束一张新的个人专辑。他说：“我一直在制作很多歌曲，并且由于巡回演出而不得不将其放在一边。” “因此，我希望能重新融入其中并完成许多这些歌曲。那么，那怎么样？ “我的新年决议是完成新专辑！”

同时，这位音乐家在纽约市播放了三场惊喜的亲密演出，并表示， 对版权法的拟议更改将使AI可以剥夺艺术家并导致“创造力丧失” 。

这部电影由加雷斯·埃文斯（Gareth Evans）执导，哈迪（Hardy）由联合主演蒂莫西·奥利芬特（Timothy Olyphant）和森林·惠特克（Forest Whitaker）加入。 59秒的剪辑在许多令人兴奋的动作场景中，带有汽车追逐和枪声，同时还与奥斯卡奖得主惠特克（Whitaker）面对面。 “别忘了，我知道你在做什么。”惠特克的角色威胁着不祥的回答：“你不知道我做了什么”。

官方的提要写道：“沃克（汤姆·哈迪）是一名受伤的侦探，他在犯罪黑社会中战斗，威胁要吞噬整个城市。在毒品交易发生后，沃克发现自己的尾巴上有许多派系。一个复仇的犯罪集团，弯曲的政治家以及他的警察。当试图营救政治家疏远的儿子时，他参与毒品交易的人开始揭开深刻的腐败和阴谋，他被迫面对他过去的恶魔。”

这部电影在动作类型中汇集了两个重要的才华 - 哈迪，以他在传奇和律法等电影中的艰难角色而闻名。埃文斯（Evans）被认为是突袭电影和他的电视连续剧《伦敦》（London）的邪教成功之后，他被认为是最激动人心的作家导演之一。

这部电影于2021年在威尔士拍摄， 威尔士政府的新闻稿将其作为该国有史以来最大的电影之一。

除了破坏外，哈迪还在制作尚未透露姓名的盖伊·里奇（Guy Ritchie）系列。去年年底，据报道，他提出要介入并支付欠其工作人员的工资。

Shirley Manson 's iconic polka dot dress from Garbage 's 'I Think I'm Paranoid' video has been sold for $31,000.

  • READ MORE: Garbage's Shirley Manson: “We're losing bands from working class beginnings and risk-takers”

The dress was featured as part of a fundraising auction hosted by the nonprofit organization Give A Fuck Los Angeles and Julien's Auctions with all proceeds made going towards helping those affected by the Los Angeles wildfires, which began on January 7.

Other items available included Paramore 's Hayley Williams 'This Is Why' video and stage ensembles from the band's opening slot on Taylor Swift 's 'Eras' tour, Chappell Roan 's iconic 'Hot To Go' music video and stage outfit and a signed Dave Grohl Epiphone DG-335 signature electric guitar.

Now, Manson took to the band's official Facebook page to share that the 'I Think I'm Paranoid' dress had sold and raised a massive amount of money. “哦。我的。 GLOB!!!!!!!! This Paranoid dress raised over 31 THOUSAND DOLLARS for @gaflosangeles. I am absolutely GOBSMACKED,” began her message.

She continued: “This is a public message to whoever donated so generously to this auction. You are angels – every last one of you – but ESPECIALLY the person who bought my wee dress. You have done something wonderful in the world for people who have lost so much – in some cases EVERYTHING – in the LA fires.

“I don't know too much about much at all but I do know this: Acts of love, acts of kindness and acts of great generosity- they have the power to SHIFT ENERGY and change the world.
Thank you a million times over. Love trumps Hate. Community is everything. Let's keep holding each others hands. PS。 To whoever bought my dress, I have a gift for you.”

Previously announcing the donation of the dress in an Instagram post, Manson wrote: “I'm really hoping it goes to someone wonderful, someone who loves our band. Someone who will give generously for a good cause. I want you to know that it was hard to let this wee dress of mine go. It's a tiny little whiff of a thing but it symbolises so much for me.”

She continued: “I hope whoever secures the winning bid will appreciate her. Sending out so much love to everyone in LA affected by the fires. Gratitude to everyone who has organised or participated in events and collections for those who need help so urgently. So many amazing people and organisations in this wild and wonderful city and the gorgeous sprawling state of California. #donateifyoucan #giveafuckLA”

In an Instagram post shared by Garbage on their official account, the band posted a photo of themselves backstage and revealed that their eighth studio album will be released at some point this year.

在Instagram上查看此帖子

A post shared by 垃圾 （@垃圾）

“Because we are super mature and sophisticated. And because we have a new record coming out this year. And because it will be our eighth studio album. And it will be our thirtieth year of making music together. And because we are worth it,” read the post's accompanying caption.

Garbage's last album, 'No Gods No Masters' arrived back in 2021. Speaking to NME in a previous interview , Manson opened up about how the hugely positive response to the project has left her feeling inspired for its soon-to-be-announced follow-up.

“I was really delighted that 'No Gods No Masters' was received so well because we had no expectations whatsoever. Going into this next record, I feel a shift. I'm trying to dampen my outrage,” she explained.

“It's a searchlight, this record. After scorching the earth, we're coming out of a filthy cave with a searchlight. We're looking for shards of life and humanity.”

Steve Jones has said it “wasn't even worth asking” John Lydon to participate in Sex Pistols ' reunion shows.

The London punk band, who last performed with Lydon in 2008, headed out on a UK comeback tour last autumn , with Frank Carter stepping in as frontman. This followed two intimate gigs at London's Bush Hall , where they played 'Never Mind The Bollocks' in full.

  • READ MORE: John Lydon: “Daft Punk wanted to work with me a while back, but I didn't feel the vibe”

They have since announced further live appearances for 2025, including Download Festival and the Teenage Cancer Trust series at London's Royal Albert Hall . Additionally, guitarist Jones told NME that Sex Pistols would be hitting the road in the US .

During a new interview with Rolling Stone AU – ahead of the group's spring tour dates in New Zealand and Australia – Jones explained that he and his bandmates hadn't spoken to Lydon in 17 years .

Their relationship suffered further after the former frontman lost a court battle over the use of Sex Pistols' music in Danny Boyle's 2022 biographical mini-series, Pistol .

“We don't talk,” Jones told RS AU . “The last time I spoke to him was 2008. But I wish him all the best.我真的We had a great time when we were young, and it was life-changing for all of us.

“But after the court case with Pistol it wasn't even worth asking John [about the reunion tour]. I don't think he was interested.”

During an interview with NME last month , Jones was asked whether he would ever get back in touch with Lydon (aka Johnny Rotten). He responded: “Who knows? You never know…” The musician also looked back on touring with the ex-frontman.

“I like John. He's a funny guy; he's got a great sense of humour and he's sharp. It just kind of ran its course, that whole relationship,” Jones told NME . “I wish him well. He's going out this year, doing PiL again , and I hope he does well. I know he must be in a weird place, losing his wife and his best mate.” ( Lydon's wife Nora Forster died in 2023 , as did his long-time friend and manager John “Rambo” Stevens).

Elsewhere in the conversation, the guitarist spoke about if he thought Lydon's support of President Trump could tarnish the Pistols' legacy.

Despite Jones' positive comments and well wishes, Lydon recently claimed that his estranged bandmates hadn't reached out following his wife's passing. “They're dead to me,” he told NME . “They're poison.”

Lydon also shared his thoughts on Jones, Glen Matlock and Paul Cook , and their decision to hit the road with Carter acting as frontman.

“It's almost malicious in its intent,” he told NME . And it's karaoke – that's all it will ever be. Bloody hell, The Three Stooges in that band have had how many years to write some new songs? That's what I'd like to hear.”

In a recent edition of the Classic Album Review podcast, Lydon hit out at the remaining Pistols members for “eliminating the purpose” of the band by not including him in recent tours and announcements.

“I wrote the fucking songs, didn't I? I gave them the image. I was the frontman. I am the voice that made the whole world sing,” he said. “They profess their hatred for me, but they can't live without me. I am the punishment that goes on giving.”

While at Download 2024 , Carter spoke to NME about why he wanted to be a part of the Sex Pistols reunion tour .

Last November, NME asked bassist Matlock if he was surprised to see Lydon come out as pro-Trump. He replied: “Way back when, there was something about John that I didn't get on with because I couldn't quite put my finger on it.

“And him coming out with that kind of encapsulates the whole thing, really. John was fantastic back then. He wrote some great lyrics, but did he really mean 'em? Ah, that's the thing. I never found him that sincere.”
